techmeme.title: TSMC says its HPC group, which includes AI and server chips, accounted for 52% of wafer revenue in Q2, the first time it made up the majority of sales (Bloomberg)
Venture funding to cybersecurity startups grew to $4.4B in Q2 2024, up 144% YoY; funding in H1 2024 was $7.1B, up from $4.7B in H1 2023 (Chris Metinko/Crunchbase News)
Xiaomi unveils the Mix Fold 4, starting at ~$1,237, and the Mix Flip, its first flip foldable, with a 4.01" cover display, starting at ~$825, available in China (Damien Wilde/9to5Google)
Over 200 Bethesda Game Studios workers unionize with the CWA, forming the first "wall-to-wall" union at a Microsoft game studio; Microsoft recognized the union (Dean Takahashi/VentureBeat)
Oracle agrees to pay $115M to settle a lawsuit accusing it of invading people's privacy by collecting their personal information and selling it to third parties (Jonathan Stempel/Reuters)
